summary: The Carpathians are a long mountain range in Europe, stretching from the Czech Republic to Serbia. They are the third-longest mountain range on the continent. The highest peaks are in the Tatra Mountains, reaching over 8,500 feet. These mountains are home to many animals like bears and wolves, and they have lots of unique plants. Romania, in particular, has a lot of forest areas and natural springs. Unfortunately, some parts of the Carpathians are being damaged by illegal tree cutting.
title: Carpathian Mountains
